title: Heavily formatted messages slow down message rendering
body:
**_Type_**: Bug

**_Summary_**: When there is a message which requires formatting in chat, it appears on chat view much longer than plain-text messages. More items in a single message require formatting - exponentially more time for message to be parsed and displayed to user. 
When messages are really large and there are a lot of items to process - app freezes during that time (below figures are app-freezes values)

For example, on Samsung Galaxy Note 4 (Android 6.0.1) - slow device:
1) The time it takes for a single message having 100 links and 1000 chars in total (including whitespaces) when navigating from Chats view to public chat with the message -> ~3.5 seconds
2) Same number of characters but when no any formatting is applied to message content takes <0.3s 
3) 5 messages with 200 chars and 20 links each (so 1st case above but split in 5 messages) - takes ~2 seconds for messages to appear
4) 5 messages with 200 chars each (so 2nd case above but split in 5 messages) - takes <0.3 seconds for messages to appear

#### Expected behavior
When user of the `Samsung Galaxy Note 4`-like device navigates to chat with the single message which has any type of formatted text (bold, italic, backquoted, link, tag) repeated 250 times with 2500 chars in total, the time it takes from chat view (actual chat, excluded navigation between 'Chats' -> 'Chat') and the actual message content to appear - is less than 0.3s

#### Actual behavior
When user of the `Samsung Galaxy Note 4`-like device navigates to chat with the single message which has any type of formatted text (bold, italic, backquoted, link, tag) repeated 250 times with 2500 chars in total, the time it takes from chat view (actual chat, excluded navigation between 'Chats' -> 'Chat') and the actual message content to appear is:

| Text | Links | Tags | Bold | Italic | Backquotes | Mix of everything (without text) |
| ------------- | ------------- | ------------- | ------------- | ------------- | ------------- | ------------- | 
| <0.3s | 26s | 26s | 16s | 16s | 26s | 23s |

VIdeo for above measurements from Galaxy Note 4: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-0rUsqj5_OjK1HiDqu-AXYLylvyt_ezD/view
Message content used in Video you can get here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1pXvXuwZ0AR-pJ5BPsiZL1a1V5LajLMQAeBd6FsMUN_o/edit?usp=sharing 

### Reproduction


* Open Status and create new account
* Join unique public chat 
* Send message with text required formatting (you can get data from the above link)
* Navigate back to Chats view
* Navigate to chat with the message sent and pay attention until message appears

### Additional Information


* Status version: Develop0.13.0/Release0.12.2
* Operating System: Android and iOS and Desktop
We currently have bad formatting parsing. We parse messages slowly & multiple times. Best solution would be to parse on go side, but 23s is unacceptable regardless. Down to 1s would be ideal.

➤ Oskar Thoren commented:

Andrey S what's the state of this? Right now it is estimated for May 14 (1d). It'd be good to update with new date, duration and owner (if different).

➤ Andrey S commented:

with Rachel Hamlin and Igor Mandrigin we decided to make bounties for this, and it's awaiting approval

➤ Igor Mandrigin commented:

actually Eric already did some improvements there, and he was measuring even more... so I consider it "in progress"

➤ Oskar Thoren commented:

So who is owning it ? Right now this is empty.

➤ Nabil Naghdy commented:

Should this be assigned to Eric D instead? Any update on this?

➤ Rachel Hamlin commented:

It's on the core UI project board. No one in particular is owning it from engineering because there's not even a bounty on it yet—I've pinged the appropriate people about this in #status-peopleops and via email.

➤ Eric D commented:

I think this could be closed because the title isn't really accurate. There is 99 problems here and parsing ain't one because it is already done when you navigate to a chat, the messages are stored parsed in the db:
- the nested text component used for messages with formatting was suboptimal, I fixed it and at this point I think it can hardly be more efficient
- according to profiling the js thread isn't the bottleneck anymore here
- it's the native rendering itself that seem to be slow, so this is what has to be researched, to figure out if there is some small details we are missing out or if we just hit a glass ceiling in terms of performance

My suggestion would be to redefine the problems/tasks as follow:
- just like we do read-more for long messages, we could use some trick to not display messages that abuse formatting, because this seem to be what the rendering chokes on: too many components to render at once
- general flatlist performance investigation (there is also the case of the assets list in the wallet)

➤ Eric D commented:

First suggestion having the lowest cost/highest reward and short term effect

➤ Oskar Thoren commented:

Igor Mandrigin can you close this if you agree with above, or come up with next steps / fork issue / delegate or whatever else is needed to bring closure to this issue?

➤ Oskar Thoren commented:

Eric D thanks, do we have defined issues for these in your view more high impact ones?

Also cc Roman Volosovskyi for his POV

➤ Igor Mandrigin commented:

I think apart from the wrong title, the issue stands valid, it has repro steps and results that aren't dependent on what is the reason behind messages being rendered slowly.
Basically, we know that heavily formatted messages are super slow to render, and of course, we can identify multiple different reasons why does that happen, and file multiple PRs to fix them, but it is the same user-facing issue anyway.
So we can just rename it to "Heavily formatted messages slow down message rendering" and keep it there.

➤ Rachel Hamlin commented:

We'll keep it open and I'll follow up on bounties today :)
@rachelhamlin @mandrigin - what experience level shall be set for this bounty?
@StatusSceptre I think medium is okay. Thanks!

➤ Igor Mandrigin commented:

Rachel Hamlin I think I found a solution to this issue, currently working on it in https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/8410

➤ Rachel Hamlin commented:

Doesn't look like we have any applicants for the bounty so that's great Igor Mandrigin.

➤ Igor Mandrigin commented:

okay, hopefully final tests will pass today and I'll be able to merge it
